biography.summary: Cory Anthony Booker is a United States Senator from New Jersey who has served since 2013. He previously served as the Mayor of Newark (2006-2013).
biography.early_life: Born April 27, 1969 in Washington, D.C. and raised in Harrington Park, New Jersey.
biography.education: Stanford University (B.A., 1991); studied at the University of Oxford as a Marshall Scholar (1992-1993); Yale Law School (J.D., 1998).
biography.career: Practiced law and community organizing; mayor of Newark; U.S. Senator; advocate on criminal justice reform, urban policy, and civil rights.

contact.office_address: 717 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports expanding access to healthcare and protecting coverage.
Advocates comprehensive reform and reducing mass incarceration.
Supports universal background checks and sensible gun safety measures.

bills_sponsored.title: Bipartisan Criminal Justice Reform Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Would reform enforcement and reduce racial disparities in the justice system.

bills_sponsored.title: Education for All Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Expands access to quality education and increases funding for under-resourced schools.

timeline.event: Became Mayor of Newark, New Jersey.
Elected and began serving as U.S. Senator from New Jersey.
Advocated for criminal justice reform and expanded healthcare discussion at the federal level.
Appointed as Vice Chair of the Senate Democratic Policy & Communications Committee.
Began serving as Chair of the Senate Democratic Strategic Communications Committee.

videos.title: Cory Booker speaks on justice reform
